respStmt.name: Craig A. Berry, Martin Mueller, and Clifford Wulfman
Lawrence Berland, Hilary Bina, Katherine Gould, Kreg Segal, Nicholas Terrell

publicationStmt.p: The WordHoard Shakespeare is a joint project of the Perseus Project at Tufts University, The Northwestern University Library, and Northwestern University Academic Technologies. It is derived from The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare , edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright (1891-3). The Internet Shakespeare editions of the quartos and folios have been consulted to create a modern text that observes as closely as possible the morphological and prosodic practices of the earliest editions. Spellings, especially of contracted and hyphenated forms, have been standardized across the corpus. The text has been fully lemmatized and morphosyntactically tagged.

© 2003. The copyright to The WordHoard Shakespeare is owned jointly by Northwestern University and Tufts University. The WordHoard Shakespeare is provided for free solely for non-commercial use by students, scholars, and the public. Any commercial use or publication of it, in whole or in part, without prior written authorization of the copyright holders is strictly prohibited.

sourceDesc.p: The Wordhoard Shakespeare is derived from, but not identical with, The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare (1891-3) edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 1
div.stage: A desert place. Thunder and lightning.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 2
div.stage: A camp near Forres. Alarum within.
Enter DUNCAN, MALCOLM, DONALBAIN, LENNOX, with Attendants, meeting a bleeding Sergeant.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 4
div.stage: Enter DUNCAN, MALCOLM, DONALBAIN, LENNOX, and Attendants.

l.stage: Enter MACBETH, BANQUO, ROSS, and ANGUS.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 5
div.stage: Enter LADY MACBETH, reading a letter.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 6
div.stage: Before Macbeth's castle. Hautboys and torches.
Enter DUNCAN, MALCOLM, DONALBAIN, BANQUO, LENNOX, MACDUFF, ROSS, ANGUS, and Attendants.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 7
div.stage: Enter a Sewer, and divers Servants with dishes and service, and pass over the stage. Then enter MACBETH.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter BANQUO, and FLEANCE bearing a torch before him.

l.stage: Enter MACBETH, and a Servant with a torch.
Re-enter MACBETH and LENNOX, with ROSS.
Exeunt all but Malcolm and Donalbain.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 4
div.stage: Enter ROSS and an Old Man.

l.stage: Enter MACBETH, as king, LADY MACBETH, as queen, LENNOX, ROSS, Lords, Ladies, and Attendants.
Exeunt all but Macbeth, and an attendant.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter LADY MACBETH and a Servant.

l.stage: Enter BANQUO, and FLEANCE with a torch.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 4
div.stage: The same. Hall in the palace. A banquet prepared.
Enter MACBETH, LADY MACBETH, ROSS, LENNOX, Lords, and Attendants.

l.stage: First Murderer appears at the door.
The Ghost of Banquo enters, and sits in Macbeth's place.
Exeunt all but Macbeth and Lady M.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 5
div.stage: Enter the three Witches, meeting HECATE.

l.stage: Music and a song within: “Come away, come away,” etc.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 1
div.stage: A cavern. In the middle, a boiling cauldron. Thunder.

l.stage: Enter HECATE to the other three Witches.
Music and a song: “Black spirits,” c.
Third Apparition: a Child crowned, with a tree in his hand.
A show of Eight Kings, the last with a glass in his hand; Banquo's Ghost following.
The Witches dance, and then vanish, with Hecate.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter LADY MACDUFF, her Son, and ROSS.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter a Doctor of Physic and a Waiting-Gentlewoman.

sp.speaker: Gentlewoman
sp.stage: Enter LADY MACBETH, with a taper.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 2
div.stage: The country near Dunsinane. Drum and colours.
Enter MENTEITH, CAITHNESS, ANGUS, LENNOX, and Soldiers.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 3
div.stage: Dunsinane. A room in the castle.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 4
div.stage: Country near Birnam mood. Drum and colours.
Enter MALCOLM, old SIWARD and his Son, MACDUFF, MENTEITH, CAITHNESS, ANGUS, LENNOX, ROSS, and Soldiers, marching.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 5
div.stage: Enter MACBETH, SEYTON, and Soldiers, with drum and colours.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 6
div.stage: Dunsinane. Before the castle. Drum and colours.
Enter MALCOLM, old SIWARD, MACDUFF, and their Army, with boughs.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 7
div.stage: Another part of the field. Alarums.

l.stage: They fight and young Siward is slain.
Enter, with drum and colours, MALCOLM, old SIWARD, ROSS, the other Thanes, and Soldiers.
